content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A ball of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> is attached to a string of length <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. The ball moves clockwise in a vertical circle at a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. When the ball is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, the magnitude of the tension in the string is <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. (a) The speed of the ball is then increased to speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> such that <math alttext="v sub 2, end sub, is greater than v sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. The ball is again swung so that it moves in a vertical circle at constant speed. Now when the ball is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, the magnitude of the tension in the string is <math alttext="F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. Indicate whether <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> is greater than, less than, or equal to <math alttext="F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>.__________<math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub, is greater than F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> __________<math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub, is less than F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> __________ <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub, equals F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>Justify your answer using qualitative reasoning beyond referencing equations.

frqParts.text: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A ball of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> is attached to a string of length <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. The ball moves clockwise in a vertical circle at a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. When the ball is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, the magnitude of the tension in the string is <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. (a) The speed of the ball is then increased to speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> such that <math alttext="v sub 2, end sub, is greater than v sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. The ball is again swung so that it moves in a vertical circle at constant speed. Now when the ball is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, the magnitude of the tension in the string is <math alttext="F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. Indicate whether <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> is greater than, less than, or equal to <math alttext="F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>.__________<math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub, is greater than F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> __________<math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub, is less than F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> __________ <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub, equals F sub T 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>Justify your answer using qualitative reasoning beyond referencing equations.

(b) Starting with Newtonâ€™s second law, derive an expression for the tension in the string <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> as the ball moves in a vertical circle at a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Express your answer in terms of <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>M</mi></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>R</mi></mstyle></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate. Begin your derivation by writing a fundamental physics principle or an equation from the reference booklet.

(c) Justify how the expression to derived for <math alttext="F sub T 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> you derived in part (b) is or is not consistent with the claim made in part (a).

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
